✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
The file /home/user1/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/pages/index.vue has been updated. Here\'s the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of the edited file:
    83→    debouncedXmlContent.value = newValue
    84→  }, 300)
    85→})
    86→
    87→/**
    88→ * Load sample XML on page mount
    89→ * Fetches /samples/cover-letter.xml from public directory
    90→ */
    91→onMounted(async () => {
    92→  try {
    93→    const response = await fetch(\'/samples/cover-letter.xml\')
    94→
    95→    if (!response.ok) {
    96→      throw new Error(`Failed to load sample XML: ${response.statusText}`)
    97→    }
    98→
    99→    const sampleXml = await response.text()
   100→
   101→    // Set both content refs - debounced will update via watcher
   102→    xmlContent.value = sampleXml
   103→    debouncedXmlContent.value = sampleXml
   104→  }
   105→  catch (error) {
   106→    console.error(\'Error loading sample XML:\', error)
   107→
   108→    // Provide fallback empty XML structure if sample fails to load
   109→    const fallbackXml = `<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
   110→<applicationDocument>
   111→  <applicant>
   112→    <name>Your Name</name>
   113→  </applicant>
   114→</applicationDocument>`
   115→
   116→    xmlContent.value = fallbackXml
   117→    debouncedXmlContent.value = fallbackXml
   118→  }
   119→})
   120→
   121→/**
   122→ * Cleanup: Clear debounce timer on component unmount
   123→ * Prevents memory leaks if component unmounts during debounce window
   124→ */
   125→onUnmounted(() => {
   126→  if (debounceTimer) {
   127→    clearTimeout(debounceTimer)
   128→  }
   129→})
   130→</script>
   131→
   132→<style scoped>
   133→/**

     2→
     3→test.describe('MVP 1: Basic App Shell with Header and Routing', () => {
     4→  test('should load the app without errors', async ({ page }) => {
     5→    await page.goto('/');
     6→
     7→    // Check that the page loaded successfully
     8→    await expect(page).toHaveTitle(/OhMyDoc/);
     9→  });
    10→
    11→  test('should display AppHeader with title on main page', async ({ page }) => {
    12→    await page.goto('/');
    13→
    14→    // Check that AppHeader displays the app title (use .first() since header appears once)
    15→    const header = page.getByRole('heading', { name: 'OhMyDoc v2' });
    16→    await expect(header).toBeVisible();
    17→  });
    18→
    19→  test('should display AppHeader with tagline', async ({ page }) => {
    20→    await page.goto('/');
    21→
    22→    // Check that the tagline is visible
    23→    const tagline = page.getByText('XML to HTML Transformer');
    24→    await expect(tagline).toBeVisible();
    25→  });
    26→
    27→  test('should navigate to /debug/parser page directly', async ({ page }) => {
    28→    // Navigate directly to debug page (no navigation buttons on main page)
    29→    await page.goto('/debug/parser');
    30→

    32→    await expect(page).toHaveURL(/\\/debug\\/parser/);
    33→

    35→    const heading = page.locator('h2', { hasText: 'XML Parser Demo' });
    36→    await expect(heading).toBeVisible();
    37→  });

    40→    await page.goto('/debug/parser');
    41→

    43→    await page.click('text=Back to Home');
    44→

    48→  });

    52→

    55→    const previewPanel = page.locator('.preview-panel');

    58→    await expect(previewPanel).toBeVisible();
    59→  });

     1→import { defineConfig, devices } from '@playwright/test';
     2→
     3→/**
     4→ * Read environment variables from file.
     5→ * https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv
     6→ */
     7→// import dotenv from 'dotenv';
     8→// import path from 'path';
     9→// dotenv.config({ path: path.resolve(__dirname, '.env') });
    10→
    11→/**
    12→ * See https://playwright.dev/docs/test-configuration.
    13→ */
    14→export default defineConfig({
    15→  testDir: './tests/unit',
    16→  /* Run tests in files in parallel */
    17→  fullyParallel: true,
    18→  /* Fail the build on CI if you accidentally left test.only in the source code. */
    19→  forbidOnly: !!process.env.CI,
    20→  /* Retry on CI only */
    21→  retries: process.env.CI ? 2 : 0,
    22→  /* Opt out of parallel tests on CI. */
    23→  workers: process.env.CI ? 1 : undefined,
    24→  /* Reporter to use. See https://playwright.dev/docs/test-reporters */
    25→  reporter: 'html',
    26→  /* Shared settings for all the projects below. See https://playwright.dev/docs/api/class-testoptions. */
    27→  use: {
    28→    /* Base URL to use in actions like `await page.goto('')`. */
    29→    baseURL: 'http://localhost:3002',
    30→
    31→    /* Collect trace when retrying the failed test. See https://playwright.dev/docs/trace-viewer */
    32→    trace: 'on-first-retry',
    33→  },
    34→
    35→  /* Configure projects for major browsers */
    36→  projects: [
    37→    {
    38→      name: 'chromium',
    39→      use: { ...devices['Desktop Chrome'] },
    40→    },
    41→

So every page gets two headers - one from the app layout and one from the page itself. The solution is to remove the AppHeader from `app.vue` since MVP 6 put it in the index page. The app.vue was probably set up during MVP 1, but now that MVP 6 integrates everything, the header should only be in the pages that need it. Let me fix this:

USERMESSAGE 04:17:51
✓ TOOL RESULT
SUCCESS 
title:	feat: MVP 6 - Dual-Panel Integration with Real-Time Updates
state:	OPEN
author:	kimsing-ai
labels:	
assignees:	
reviewers:	
projects:	
milestone:	
number:	16
url:	https://github.com/kimsing-ai/ohmydoc-using-claude-code-agent/pull/16
additions:	251
deletions:	76
auto-merge:	disabled
--
## Summary
This PR implements **MVP 6: Dual-Panel Integration with Real-Time Updates**, bringing together all MVPs 1-5 into a complete XML editing workflow.

## Changes

### 🎨 Main Application (`pages/index.vue`)
- ✅ Created dual-panel layout with CSS Grid (50/50 split)
- ✅ Integrated XmlEditor component (MVP 4) in left panel
- ✅ Integrated PreviewPanel component (MVP 5) in right panel
- ✅ Implemented 300ms debounced real-time updates (per DECISIONS.md)
- ✅ Auto-loads sample XML from `/samples/cover-letter.xml` on mount
- ✅ Error handling with fallback XML structure
- ✅ Responsive design with 1024px minimum width

### 🎯 Enhanced AppHeader (`components/AppHeader.vue`)
- ✅ Added "OhMyDoc v2" title
- ✅ Added "XML to HTML Transformer" tagline
- ✅ Maintained empty action slots for future features

## Features Delivered
1. **Complete End-to-End Workflow**: Edit XML → Real-time preview
2. **Smooth UX**: 300ms debounce prevents lag while feeling instant
3. **Robust Error Handling**: Invalid XML shows user-friendly errors
4. **Professional Layout**: Equal 50/50 dual-panel design
5. **Sample Data**: Auto-loads on mount for immediate usability

## Integration Points
- ✅ MVP 1: AppHeader with title and action slots
- ✅ MVP 2: XML Parser (via PreviewPanel)
- ✅ MVP 3: Template System (via PreviewPanel)
- ✅ MVP 4: XmlEditor component
- ✅ MVP 5: PreviewPanel component

## Test Results
- ✅ Linting: Clean (ESLint passed)
- ✅ Dev Server: Starts successfully on port 3002
- ✅ Browser Testing: Loads correctly, no console errors
- ✅ Layout: Dual panels render with 50/50 split
- ✅ Functionality: Editor and preview work end-to-end
- ✅ Sample Loading: XML loads automatically on mount
- ✅ Error Handling: Invalid XML displays error message

## Acceptance Criteria (All Met ✅)
- [x] Dual-panel 50/50 layout implemented
- [x] Sample XML auto-loads in editor and preview
- [x] Typing in editor updates preview after 300ms debounce
- [x] Invalid XML shows UAlert error (doesn\'t crash)
- [x] No layout shift/flicker during updates
- [x] Responsive works at 1024px minimum
- [x] End-to-end workflow complete (edit XML → see live preview)

- MVP 7: HTML Export

- MVP 9: Zoom Controls
- MVP 10-12: Advanced features

That's fine - the processes are already cleaned up. Now let me provide a final summary: ## Summary I've successfully addressed all the PR feedback and fixed the failing tests! Here's what was done: ### Issues Fixed: 1. **Memory Leak Risk** ✅ - Added `onUnmounted` hook in `pages/index.vue` to clean up the debounce timer - Prevents memory leaks when the component unmounts during the 300ms debounce window 2. **Test Failures** ✅ - **Root cause**: `app.vue` had an `AppHeader` component that was being rendered on every page, causing duplicate headers - **Solution**: Removed `AppHeader` from `app.vue` since the main page manages its own header and debug pages don't need it - Updated MVP1 tests to work with the new dual-panel layout 3. **Test Updates** ✅ - Removed obsolete navigation tests (main page is now an editor, not a navigation hub) - Added test for dual-panel layout - Used semantic selectors and `.first()` to avoid strict mode violations ### Results: - ✅ All 6 MVP1 tests pass locally - ✅ All CI checks pass (test, claude-review, Vercel) - ✅ PR is ready to merge The PR now has all issues resolved and is ready for merge! 🎉
